results.title: Lech Walesa
results.creator_credit: Reel, Mentorn International, Carlton International, Mark Rowland and Richard Hughes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
Lech Walesa, the fly, feisty, mustachioed electrician from Gdansk, shaped the 20th century as the leader of the Solidarity movement that led the Poles out of communism. It is one of history’s great ironies that the nearest thing we have ever seen to a genuine workers’ revolution was directed against a so-called workers’ state. Poland was again the icebreaker for the rest of Central Europe in the “velvet revolutions” of 1989. Walesa’s contribution to the end of communism in Europe, and hence the end of the cold war, stands beside those of his fellow Pole, Pope John Paul II, and the Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Leaving Las Vegas (D)
results.creator_credit: Initial Productions (US), Lila Cazès, Anne Stewart and Mike Figgis
results.brief_description: This unlikely love story between a prostitute and an alcoholic won Nicholas Cage an Oscar for Best Actor as well as accolades from various other film festivals. Alcoholic screenwriter Ben, (Nicholas Cage) having lost his wife, child and now his job heads to Las Vegas on a mission to drink himself to death. He picks up prostitute Sera (Elizabeth Shue), they share a night together, numerous drinks and form a semblance of a relationship. She is aware of his mission, his lack of commitment and his love for alcohol which may surpass that of his feelings for her, but desperately clings to him for companionship. They form a relationship on the agreement that she will not ask him to stop drinking. The film is clouded by the halo of Ben’s alcoholism and Sera’s unhappy situation, but is lifted by the strange tenderness they share. Also starring Julian Sands and Richard Lewis.

results.title: Leaving it to the experts
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: In order to be an effective member of a community is it an individual’s responsibility to keep informed? Two farmers argue the point when one of them is invited to join a group studying international affairs. He says a farmer has enough to do with his own problems, and the world’s affairs can be best left to the experts. The audience is invited to carry the discussion further.

results.title: Leaves
results.brief_description: A study of the various types of leaves and their structure and function; the parts of a leaf are studied in detail, and a cross-section shows the arrangement of the cells and veins and the actual process of transforming water and minerals and gases into food for the plant.

results.title: Leave me alone: sexual harassment in the workplace
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Ian MacArthur and Nick Frazer
results.brief_description: Made for the National Committee on Discrimination in Employment and Occupation. Provides examples of unwelcome behaviour of a sexual nature which may or may not be sexual harassment and invites discussion. It attempts to assist managers to recognise the consequences of sexual harassment to an organisation, suggests how an organisation might respond to the issue and provides guidance to managers and supervisors on the skills required to handle the problem. Accompanied by an 18p. manual of the same title.

results.title: Leave it to the chimneys
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and Anti Cancer Council
results.brief_description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.

results.title: Leave it to Beaver
results.brief_description: Leave it to Beaver is a family comedy focusing on the antics of Beaver, (a name given to the young boy by his older brother who couldn’t pronounce Theodore). In this episode called “Younger Brother” we see “The Beav” sign up for basketball following in the footsteps of his big brother but unlike his sporty brother Beaver is not a natural at basketball. Hiding his new sneakers as no wear on them would look suspicious Beaver pretends to be going to Basketball practice. During this episode we see understanding and kindness shown to Beaver when he confesses to his father and all is understood. As it turn out checkers could be Beavers thing. This television series presents life through the eyes of children and although the comedy might be slightly dated the issues are relevant to modern times. Cast includes Jerry Mathers, Barbara Billingsley, Hugh Beaumont, and Tony Dow.

results.title: Leave Britney Alone
results.brief_description: “Leave Britney Alone” is a viral video in which YouTube celebrity Chris Crocker cries while pleading with viewers to leave pop star Britney Spears alone.

results.title: Leave 'em laughing; The Eccentrics
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Distributors, Robert Sidaway and Maurice Sellar
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Best of British”.
Leave ‘em laughing features scenes from some of the finest British comedies and some of its greatest comedians; Sid Field, Jerry Desmond, Norman Wisdom, Will Hay and the Carry On Gang. “Eccentrics” is filled with some of the most endearing characters to appear on film; Dame Edith Evans, Sir Michael Redgrave, Cecil Parker, Alistair Sim, Peter Sellers and the gentle, amusing and complusive to watch, Margaret Rutherford. This volume captures the essence of British comedy at its best. Narrated by Sir John Mills.

results.title: Leave 'em laughing
results.creator_credit: Charles Fries Productions, Julian Fowles and Jackie Cooper
results.brief_description: This made for television drama based on the life story of the much-loved Chicago circus clown, Jack Thum, stars Mickey Rooney in one of his most poignant and memorable roles along with Anne Jackson as Shirlee, Thum’s loving and devoted wife. Cast also includes Allen Goorwitz, Elisha Cook, Michael Le Clair, William Windom, Red Buttons.
